block.p: Allison Jane Oakes, the daughter of Bonnie Casper of Sewickley, Pa., and John S. Oakes of Minneapolis, was married yesterday to Charles Calkins Smith, a son of Carolyn Calkins and Charles Paul Smith of Doylestown, Pa. The Rev. Leslie Harry Cohen, an interfaith minister, officiated at the Puck Building in New York.

The bride, 29, is keeping her name. She is a business manager in New York for the wholesale division of Coach, the leather goods company. She graduated from Lafayette College. Her father works in Minneapolis as a senior vice president for client services of the Wells Fargo Bank. Her mother is a member of the board of the Pittsburgh-based Staunton Farm Foundation, which raises money for mental health services.

The bride, 29, is keeping her name. She is a business manager in New York for the wholesale division of Coach, the leather goods company. She graduated from Lafayette College. Her father works in Minneapolis as a senior vice president for client services of the Wells Fargo Bank. Her mother is a member of the board of the Pittsburgh-based Staunton Farm Foundation, which raises money for mental health services.

The bridegroom, 33, is the executive vice president for corporate development and planning at Real Media, an Internet advertising company in New York. He graduated from the University of Richmond. The bridegroom's mother is an owner of Calkins Newspapers, her family's newspaper and television company, based in Levittown, Pa., and is also the president of the board of the James A. Michener Art Museum in Doylestown. His father is the publisher of The Daily Intelligencer, a Calkins-owned newspaper in Doylestown.
